comment.author: 68061336@N05
comment._content: Commonwealth War Graves Commission records year of death as 1917 not 1918 CWCG full details Name: BURNHAM, HARRY EDWARD Initials: H E Nationality: United Kingdom Rank: Rifleman of death of Regiment/Service: London Regiment (Queen's Westminster Rifles) Unit Text: 1st/16th Bn. Age: 35 Date of Death: 08/04/1917 Service No: 7388 Additional information: Only son of William and Elizabeth Burnham (formerly Woodward), of Fulmer, Bucks.; husband of Alice Emma Burnham, of 47, Gordon Avenue, St. Margaret's, Middx. Casualty Type: Commonwealth War Dead Grave/Memorial Reference: G. 59. Cemetery: AGNY MILITARY CEMETERY www.cwgc.org/search/casualty_details.aspx?casualty=249576 twgpp.org/information.php?id=3024426 A photo of grave can be found here twgpp.org/information.php?id=3024426

comment.author: 63191264@N00
comment._content:
Born 1883. The 1891 census 1891 census records him living with his parents William [b.1855 Chalfont St Peter, Bucks] and Elizabeth [b.1851 Westcott?, Oxon] and younger sister Laura M [b.1885 Fulmer]. Is father is employed as a domestic servant [Gardener]. 
The census summery sheet does not record a particular address but many of those living in the village [Fulmer] seem to be domestic servants possibly in the employ of Lord Algernon Seymore whose estate adjoins the village.
He married Alice Emma Ball on 11th November 1905 at Holy Trinity Church, Hounslow. The marriage register records that he was living in Staines Road, Hounslow and that his occupation was as a Clerk.
The National Probate Calendar records the same information as the War Graves Photographic project inasmuch as the address of his marital home was 47 Gordon Avenue, St Margaret’s on Thames, Middlesex. Further that his estate was valued at £77 16s 10d
